meanings.definition: Cheap or inferior goods or material
meanings.sent1: The store was filled with shlock that no one wanted to buy.
meanings.sent2: She bought a shlock toy that broke after just one day.
meanings.sent3: The party favors were so shlock, they fell apart before the guests even arrived.
meanings.sent4: His promises were just shlock, empty and worthless.
meanings.sent5: The shlock items on the clearance rack were all damaged and unsellable.

meanings.definition: Something of low quality or value
meanings.sent1: The movie was a shlock, with terrible acting and a weak plot.
meanings.sent2: He knew the painting was a shlock, but he still bought it for sentimental reasons.
meanings.sent3: The shlock necklace turned her neck green after wearing it for just an hour.
meanings.sent4: The book was a shlock, full of cliches and predictable twists.
meanings.sent5: The shlock furniture fell apart as soon as they tried to move it.

meanings.definition: To sell or promote something in a cheap or sensational way
meanings.sent1: The company decided to shlock their new product by offering huge discounts.
meanings.sent2: She shlocked her artwork at the flea market, pricing it way below its value.
meanings.sent3: The infomercial shlocked the miracle weight loss pill as a solution to all problems.
meanings.sent4: He shlocked his novel by using exaggerated claims in the book blurb.
meanings.sent5: The store owner shlocked the outdated inventory to make room for new stock.
